Rule Name: Each task description must contain five components: what (definition), why (purpose), how (steps), when (timing/schedule/time estimates), and system/access requirements (permissions) before any action
Description:
Violation: "Submit your documents"
Solution: What: Submit identity proof, Why: Required for verification, How: Upload passport or license and When: Within 7 days
Bug_Categories: Lack of guidance about task; Privacy concerns

Rule Name: All actionable UI elements must be clearly marked/have visual affordance
Description:
Violation: A page label "Next" appears as plain body text; users don't realise it is a link.
Solution: Style "Next" as a raised button with contrasting colour, right-arrow icon, hover state, and focus outline so its clickability is unmistakable.
Bug_Categories: Lack of guidance about specific features; Unclear action requirements - obscure UI

Rule Name: When multiple methods exist for a task, each method must have its effort level and benefits clearly stated like Time required, Effort level, Technical expertise needed, Security implications, etc
Description:
Solution:
Method 1: Quick setup (5 minutes, basic features)
Method 2: Advanced setup (30 minutes, all features)
Bug_Categories: Lack of guidance about task; Unclear action requirements - redundant repeat

Rule Name: Multi-step processes must maintain a progress tracker which shows the current position, total steps, and next action
Description: Solution: Step 2 of 5: Enter Personal Details (Next: Upload Documents)

Rule Name: When multiple tasks are presented, their dependencies must be explicitly shown like visual connection lines, prerequisite flags, blocking indicators, Timeline connections etc
Description: Solution: Complete profile setup (required before accessing home/dashboard)

Rule Name: The same concept must be referred to consistently using the same term throughout the interface
Description:
Violation: Using "profile" in one place and "account" in another for same concept
Violation: Using "submit" on one form but "send" on another

Rule Name: Error messages must include three components: (1) what went wrong, (2) why it happened, and (3) how to fix it
Description:
Violation : "Login failed" (but why and how)
Solution: "Login failed because the password is incorrect. 
Please try again or click 'Forgot Password' to reset."
Bug_Categories: Error messages not tied to action and what to do next

Rule Name: Potentially risky actions must clearly indicate consequences and recovery options before execution
Description:
Violation: Delete button without consequence warning
Solution: Warning: You cannot go back once it's deleted
Bug_Categories: Error messages - no warning about error prone conditions

Rule Name: Complex or dense content should be layered with clear expansion mechanisms for additional details.
Description:
Violation : Presenting all information at once without layering
Solution: Basic overview or important info with expandable sections for details

Rule Name: Post-action feedback must include clear indication of current state/task and next possible steps
Description: Profile updated successfully. View your profile / continue editing / Go to Home.
Bug_Categories: Lack of guidance about task; Unexpected screen/output

Rule Name: Any request for user data must be accompanied by a clear explanation of its purpose and usage
Description:
Violation : A form input asking phone number
Solution: A question mark icon with a tooltip saying "Required for two-factor authentication to secure your account"
Bug_Categories: Lack of guidance about task; Privacy concerns

Rule Name: System must provide immediate, persistent, and contextual feedback to indicate current status/outcome
Description: Violation: After pressing "Save", the screen shows no change for several seconds; Abi wonders whether her data was stored. Solution: Immediately show a small anchored banner: "Saving…" that switches to "All changes saved" and remains until the next edit.
